instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00392: What is 820-00392? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00392</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a ic problem
threads.message: hi i have a problem with this board. ic sic 635 burned out and ruined my board Anyone know how I can fix it? thank you[ATTACH type="full"]59942[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00392</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a ic problem
threads.message:
I don't see any fix in this case.
I'm not sure what MLB do you have on the desk; surely not 00392 (is that battery code?).

However, a SICxxx chip should be for a CPU power rail.
I bet is dead now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00392</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a ic problem
threads.message: Battery is A1713

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00392</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a ic problem
threads.message:

Please, put some effort from your side and learn how to find the correct MLB code!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00392</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a ic problem

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00392</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a ic problem
threads.message:

I can suppose you have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MLB; why don't you confirm???
Really didn't get an idea from the Google link?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00392</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a ic problem

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00392</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a ic problem
threads.message:
I suppose you are talking about one of <CHIP>U7410</CHIP>/20/30.
There is the iGPU power supply.
Any of these chips burnt in such bad shape, can only means dead CPU.
This board is trash now, good for spare parts...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00392</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a ic problem
threads.message: how can i do some tests?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00392</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a ic problem
threads.message: If you lift corresponding coils, will find short to ground on CPU side for sure.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00392</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a ic problem
threads.message: I ask a stupid question: if the cpu has low resistance the multimeter doesn't always give me short?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00392</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a ic problem
threads.message:
What if you post exact ohm resistance?
Short and low resistance is not the same.
You can compare with similar good board.

The damage visible on the picture is out of doubt.
